Reflect

type
class
metadata
:core_api
The Reflect API is a way to manipulate values dynamicly through an abstract interface in an untyped manner. Use with care.

Static Methods

inline callMethod(o : Dynamic, func : Dynamic, args : Array<Dynamic>) : Dynamic

Call a method with the given object and arguments.

compare<T>(a : T, b : T) : Int

Generic comparison function, does not work for methods, see compareMethods

compareMethods(f1 : Dynamic, f2 : Dynamic) : Bool

Compare two methods closures. Returns true if it's the same method of the same instance.

copy<T>(o : T) : T

Make a copy of the fields of an object.

deleteField(o : Dynamic, f : String) : Bool

Delete an object field.

field(o : Dynamic, field : String) : Dynamic

Returns the field of an object, or null if o is not an object or doesn't have this field.

fields(o : Dynamic) : Array<String>

Returns the list of fields of an object, excluding its prototype (class methods).

getProperty(o : Dynamic, field : String) : Dynamic

Similar to field but also supports property (might be slower).

hasField(o : Dynamic, field : String) : Bool

Tells if an object has a field set. This doesn't take into account the object prototype (class methods).

isFunction(f : Dynamic) : Bool

Tells if a value is a function or not.

isObject(v : Dynamic) : Bool

Tells if a value is an object or not.

makeVarArgs(f : Array<Dynamic> -> Dynamic) : Dynamic

Transform a function taking an array of arguments into a function that can be called with any number of arguments.

inline setField(o : Dynamic, field : String, value : Dynamic) : Void

Set an object field value.

setProperty(o : Dynamic, field : String, value : Dynamic) : Void

Similar to setField but also supports property (might be slower).
